_header: Between midnight and the fresh morrow gray
Title(s): Fifteen Joys and Sorrows of Our Lady
Subjects: Virgin Mary, joys of; Virgin Mary, sorrows of; dream visions; envoys
_description: John Lydgate, Fifteen Joys and Sorrows of Our Lady — in rhyme royal including Prologues and an Envoy

Bod686.First Lines:
Be twene mydnyght and þe fressh morowe greyNat longe agon in
                    herte ful pensife…
Bod686.Last Lines:
…To þat entent ydo the forth directeWhere þu failest
                    þat men shal þe correcte
Bod686.Attributed Title:
xv Ioyes (RT, ff. 204-206); Here endeth the lyfe of seynt George.And here
                    begynneth þe prologe of þe xv Ioyes of our ladye (f. 204); Here
                    endeþ þe prolog of þe xv Ioyes & begyneþ þe tale
                    (f. 204v); xv heuynesse of oure ladye (f. 207); Here endeth the xv
                    heuynes of oure lady (f. 208)

CamFitzMc182.First Lines:
Goo litill boke and mekely me excuseTo all tho that schall þe
                    see or rede…
CamFitzMc182.Last Lines:
…To þat entent I doo the forthe directeWhere thow failist
                    that men schall the correcte
CamFitzMc182.Note:
Fragment (one-stanza envoy) used as envoy to 1544; with rubric heading, ‘Lenuoy’
                    and rubric ‘Explicit’.

CamJes56.First Lines:
[A]twene mydnyght and þe fressh morowe grayeNot yore ago in
                    herte full pensife…
CamJes56.Last Lines:
…To þat entent I do þe forth directeWhere þu
                    failest þat men shall þe correcte

CamTCC601.First Lines:
Betwene mydnyght and the morow fresshe grayNat yore agone in hert
                    full pensyfOf thoughtfull syghes my payne to put awayCausyd by the
                    troble of thys vnstabyll lyst…
CamTCC601.Last Lines:
…To that entent dothe forth dyrectWhere thow faylyst that men
                    shall the correct
CamTCC601.Note:
45 stanzas including two prologues of 5 and 4 stanzas and one envoy of 3
                    stanzas.
CamTCC601.Attributed Author: John Lydgate (added by later hand, ff. 238, 242)

BLCottAppXXVII.First Lines:
Thou that arte called glorie of IsraellFor that Ioye moste
                    souereyne of renoun…
BLCottAppXXVII.Last Lines:
…Of eche conseuruyd the same obserueanceAs here to forne is
                    put in remembraunce

BLHar2255.First Lines:
Atween mydnyght and the fressh morwe grayNat yore ago in herte ful
                    pensiff…
BLHar2255.Last Lines:
…To that entent I do the forth directeWher thu faylest that
                    men shal the correcte
BLHar2255.Editions:
MacCracken,  Henry Noble,
                        ed.
